title: General Election 2017: Yorkshire results - BBC News
summary: general election 2017 results and reaction from across yorkshire .
nick clegg loses his seat at sheffield hallam .
lib dems greg mulholland loses leeds north west seat to labour .
brexit secretary david davis retains haltemprice and howden seat .
labour hold sheffield brightside and hillsborough .
conservative vote holds up in rural north yorkshire .

documents.title: wakefield 16-18 leeds rhinos
text: wakefield 16-18 leeds rhinos

documents.title: catalans 12-56 huddersfield
text: catalans 12-56 huddersfield

documents.title: election 2017 : yorkshire 's winners and losers
text: that 's all from us for today .
what a 24 hours
certainly the 2017 general election has given us something that could have ramifications for years to come .
here are the winners and losers across yorkshire :
we 'll see you again from 06:30 on monday morning for the latest breaking news from across yorkshire .
phew .
author: Nick Wilmshurst
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: general election 2017 : how yorkshire looks now
text: here 's a handy visualisation of the winners and losers in the general election .
as you can see , there 's a little less blue and orange and a little bit more red :

documents.title: campaigners lose high court challenge over changes to 13th century york tower
text: campaigners have lost a high court challenge over plans for a visitor centre at york 's clifford 's tower .
they 've been fighting against historic england 's plans to build the centre and a cafe at the site which dates back to the 13th century .
they say it resembles a `` toilet block '' and would `` spoil the site '' .
english heritage was granted permission to build the £ 2m visitor centre last october .
they said the project would enhance access to the site and work was due to begin in november .
those against the plans have been given a fortnight to ask the court of appeal to consider their case .

documents.title: 'general election campaign was poor ' - east riding council leader
text: the conservative leader of east riding council says the situation after the general election is `` a complete mess '' .
speaking to bbc radio humberside , stephen parnaby has said he does n't think theresa may has a long-term future as party leader .
he said : `` i think there was an awful lot of complacency and there was a lot of expectation .
frankly i think the election campaign was poor . ''

documents.title: flights grounded at leeds bradford airport due to drone
text: flights to and from leeds bradford airport were grounded for a short time at the weekend after a drone was flown over the site , it 's been revealed .
the west yorkshire police helicopter was scrambled at about 13:00 last saturday when air traffic control alerted officers to an infringement of their airspace .
the helicopter tracked the drone to the eccup area , but the people who were remotely flying it could n't be found and today police are appealing for more information .
planes were told to remain on the ground while the search was being conducted , police say .
clearly the airport is controlled airspace and any unauthorised flying in that area presents obvious risks . ''

documents.title: listen : 'we 're in for a very uncertain period '
text: the former head of the civil service and ex-chief executive of sheffield city council has spoken of his concern for the country after yesterday 's general election .
lord kerslake , who is also chair of the board of governors at sheffield hallam university , helped prepare the conservatives for potential coalition negotiations ahead of the 2015 election .
he 's been telling me whether he thinks theresa may has the authority to remain as prime minister :
author: Steve White
BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: hull pupils 'disconcerted and confused ' by exam paper error
text: an exam board has apologised for `` poorly wording '' an a level psychology exam question , weeks after making an error in a gcse paper .
students were faced with a question asking them to `` calculate the mean percentage of words '' , normally seen in a maths exam .
exam board ocr has since apologised and said it would `` correct this in our marking '' .
damian walmsley , deputy head teacher at st mary 's college in hull , said students who sat the exam on wednesday had been left `` disconcerted and confused '' by the question .
`` the exam was stopped briefly by the invigilator , who contacted the exam board and got advice for students to ignore the question , '' he added .
author: Pritti Mistry
BBC Local Live, Hull

documents.title: the election winners and losers
text: the election winners and losers

documents.title: castleford back row foster extends deal
text: castleford back row foster extends deal

documents.title: young vote against lib dems in yorkshire
text: young vote against lib dems in yorkshire
author: Julia Bryson
BBC Local Live

documents.title: watch : south yorkshire 's labour winners react to victories
text: south yorkshire is now a sea of red after former lib dem leader nick clegg lost his sheffield hallam seat to labour .
the other 13 south yorkshire seats remained with jeremy corbyn 's party , and the successful candidates have been speaking about their wins .
sarah champion , who remains mp for rotherham after increasing her majority by 3.9 % , had this to say following her re-election :
the barnsley east constituency was always going to have a new mp after michael dugher announced he would n't seek re-election .
the successful candidate there was labour 's stephanie peacock , who gave this reaction to her victory :

documents.title: watch : 'manifesto a big turning point ' for labour - keighley 's new mp
text: labour 's john grogan is one of the new mps for west yorkshire in keighley following the general election .
mr grogan took the seat from conservative kris hopkins , but by only 249 votes .
mr grogan says that although he did n't vote for jeremy corbyn as leader , he gave the party a `` marvellous campaign '' .
he added that the labour leader has given the party hope :

documents.title: hull city : new head coach slutsky `` ca n't wait to get started ''
text: hull city 's new head coach leonid slutsky is due to arrive in east yorkshire next week to take over the role left vacant by marco silva .
he said : `` i am delighted to become the head coach of hull city and i am very much looking forward to the challenge of guiding the club back to the premier league .
`` i already know that this is an important club with a big and loyal fanbase .
i 've had a good feeling about it ever since meeting the allam family and i ca n't wait to get started , '' he added .
author: BBC Humberside Sport

documents.title: clifford 's tower campaigners refused review
text: clifford 's tower campaigners refused review

documents.title: watch : how yorkshire voted in the general election
text: the votes are counted and we now know who the winners and losers were .
while we wait to see what happens next , let 's look at the cold hard facts of how yorkshire voted in the 2017 general election :
author: David Rhodes
BBC Yorkshire

documents.title: parents ' 'pride ' in new sheffield hallam mp
text: labour 's jared o'mara is coming to terms with being elected the new mp for sheffield hallam , ousting nick clegg of the lib dems - the party 's former leader - in the process .
he 's the first ever labour mp for the constituency and his parents joined me to share how pleased they are with the news :
author: Paulette Edwards
Presenter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: extra police kept close eye on election counts
text: there were extra officers on duty at election counts across the country last night .
these officers were on patrol at the guildhall in hull :
and there were armed officers on duty at the count in boston :

documents.title: third man charged over raheem wilks murder
text: a third man has been charged with the murder of a footballer 's brother in leeds in january .
raheem wilks , 19 , the brother of leeds united 's mallik wilks , was shot near too sharps barbers in harehills .
keiran hunt , 29 , from harehills , is due to appear at leeds magistrates court charged with his murder .
keal richards , 21 , of francis street and jaydn manners , 23 , of louis street in chapeltown have also been charged with murder .

documents.title: hull city : leonid slutsky confirmed as new head coach
text: hull city has become the first club in england to employ a russian as head coach .
the former russia and c.s.k.a .
moscow boss leonid slutsky has been named as marco silva 's replacement .
he says he has a `` good feeling '' about the club .
author: Simon Clark
BBC Radio Humberside Sport

documents.title: general election : york 's views and opinions
text: i 've been in york this morning speaking to people who voted in the general election .
there was a mix of views from the members of the public i spoke to .
first up is sam who voted labour yesterday :
author: Stephanie McGovern
BBC Breakfast

documents.title: manchester attack : minute 's silence at opening of inquests
text: a minute 's silence has been held at the start of the inquests into the 22 people who died in the manchester arena attack .
five of the victims were from yorkshire .
they died when suicide bomber salman abedi detonated a home-made device in the arena 's foyer on 22 may following an ariana grande concert .
det supt jonathan chadwick told the hearing the bomb was `` designed to kill and maim indiscriminately '' .
coroner nigel meadows said the inquests at manchester civil justice centre would be adjourned until 24 november .

documents.title: selby mp nigel adams thanks voters
text: the newly-elected conservative mp for selby and ainsty , nigel adams , tweets :
he 's right .
more than half of the electorate in his constituency voted for him , but labour increased their share of the vote by 7.3 % , to his increase of 6.2 % .
he was still fairly comfortable , however , with a majority of 13,772 .
as is the national ukip were the big losers , with their vote dropping by almost 11 % .
truly humbling to have been re-elected with an increased majority and 58.5 % of the vote in # selbyandainsty thank you to everyone who voted .
hi nigel - i am very concerned about the potential `` coalition '' with the dup - can i rely on you to help represent my views ?
thank you
there wo n't be a coalition with the dup laura
i 've also emailed you and would really appreciate a response on how you will be working with the dup as per theresa may 's speech .
thank you
hopefully , you 'll find this useful
thanks nigel .
appreciate you sharing that directly .
if i have further questions should i follow up by email or twitter ?
happy for you , nigel , you 're a good mp - but , lordy , what a dog 's breakfast your leader has left us with .
# dupcoalition did n't vote for this .
do the conservatives have any morals ?
congratulations !
any chance of a move for the tory leadership ?
please ! ! ! !
theresa 's misjudgement has let corbyn too close to power and is just not acceptable
can you honestly say this country is in a stronger position now than before election was called ?
putting party b4 country , unforgivable
and now a coalition ( of sorts ) with the dup , with the kind of views that would embarrass ukip - appalling

documents.title: doncaster 's mr fishfinger fails to beat tim farron
text: a man from doncaster who dressed as a fish finger during the general election campaign while standing as an independent against tim farron in the westmorland and lonsdale constituency has failed in his bid to oust the lib dem leader .
mr fishfinger finished fourth in the poll behind the lib dems , the conservatives and labour :
during the night mr fishfinger spoke to bbc radio cumbria about why he stood dressed like he did :
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: breakingprime minister to meet the queen
text: theresa may has just left downing street for buckingham palace .
despite failing to win a majority in the general election , she 's expected to ask the queen for permission to form a new government .

documents.title: election statistics : gap of 68 years between two north yorkshire candidates
text: with elections come statistics
sometimes they 're difficult to comprehend , hard to follow .
there are exit polls , forecasts , turnout numbers - a whirlwind of facts , stats and spin , leaving you feeling dull and battered .
other times , for varying reasons , they leave you shocked and startled .
here 's a couple that fall into the latter category .
between them two north yorkshire candidates have been alive for 106 years and have a massive 68 years age gap between them .
the oldest candidate in north yorkshire was gordon johnson , an independent in scarborough who won 82 votes .
he 's 87-years-old .
meanwhile , 68 years his junior is the youngest candidate in the county who was 19-year-old jack render .
jack stood as a candidate for the yorkshire party in skipton and ripon and won 1,539 votes .

documents.title: listen : yvette cooper - election 'was a con '
text: britain has a hung parliament and not the increased conservative majority predicted by some when the general election was announced on 18 april .
the conservatives have more seats than any other party , but they do n't have enough for a workable majority in westminster .
normanton , pontefract and castleford 's labour mp , yvette cooper , held her seat overnight and says theresa may made the election a `` referendum on herself '' :

documents.title: former leeds lib dem mp sings the blues after election defeat
text: one of the victims of the general election was lib dem greg mulholland .
his old constituency of leeds north west saw a huge swing to labour of 14 % .
but he 's not letting that affect him .
he 's already changed his twitter profile to change his job to `` singer-songwriter '' :

documents.title: what happened in england 's biggest county ?
text: we have one of the of the most dramatic results in recent general election history .
instead of the expected clear increased majority in the house of commons , the conservatives lost seats and we have a hung parliament .
all north yorkshire mps kept their seats and the conservatives continue to form a ring around the labour seat of york central .
here 's phil bodmer to round up what happened in england 's largest county :

documents.title: watch : greg knight video an internet hit
text: the 2017 general election has been a particularly unusual election for one of our politicians who became an overnight internet sensation .
a campaign video featuring the east yorkshire conservative mp sir greg knight was shared around the world and became one of the most watched of the entire campaign .
here 's his story :
author: Sarah Walton
Reporter, BBC Look North

documents.title: watch : young voters speak out over general election result
text: experts and politicians of all parties have spoken during the general election campaign about the impact young voters could have .
two young voters from south yorkshire are charlie heywood-heath who voted conservative and amy smith who voted labour .
how do they feel about the result of the electoin and the political in the uk in the future ?

documents.title: listen : there could be another general election 'very soon '
text: the conservative spokesman for south yorkshire , spencer pitfield , has been giving me his reaction to the general election result .
mr pitfield , who was standing for the conservatives in the chesterfield constituency , feels the next few days will be tricky for his party and has n't ruled out a return to the polls :
author: Jenny Eells
Reporter, BBC Radio Sheffield

documents.title: nuttall quits after 'hubristic , foolish and politically naive ' election
text: more on the news that ukip leader paul nuttall 's announced at a press conference in boston , lincolnshire , that he 's resigning his post .
he says the party 's been a victim of its own success .
he came third in boston and skegness .
mr nuttall says : `` we forced the referendum and we helped win brexit and some people mistakenly think our job is done but it 's not .
`` what a hubristic , foolish and politically naive election to call .
it has put our brexit at risk . ''
author: Lizzie Musham
BBC Local Live, Lincolnshire

documents.title: breakingukip leader nuttall resigns
text: paul nuttall has resigned as the leader of ukip after his party failed to gain a single seat in westminster .
he stood for election in the boston and skegness constituency and came third .

documents.title: hilary benn thanks leeds central voters
text: voted for hilary benn in leeds central ?
the labour mp says thanks .
mr benn increased his share of the vote in his seat by 15.2 % with the conservatives also making a small gain of 3.2 % .
it 's still a very safe seat for labour :
i would like to thank the electors of leeds central for putting their trust and confidence in me once again as their member of parliament
hilary-you need to pass message round @ twitterid that an awful lot of votes for the party came from remainers.corbyn needs to recognise + act
please recognise the fantastic job jeremy has done for our party .
let 's get the tories out , and labour in .
hilary , you owe @ twitterid a massive public apology .
you spoke out against him and he 's saved your ass !
you 're mp 'cos of him .
# respect
well done to you and the many other labour mps , who not only retained their seats but also increased their majority .
# thankscorbyn
sorry but i only voted for you because of jeremy corbyn , and no other reason !

i voted labour , not benn .
he just happens to have the cushy safe seat

without him you would have no seat .
nobody wins seats all by their self
yes with activists and campaign literature paid for by the nec .
for party unity , perhaps time to acknowledge jeremy corbyn as instrumental in putting socialism back into labour & your success here .

the 'behaviour ' ?
of corbyn cronies ? ? ?

documents.title: listen : north yorkshire - an island of red in a sea of blue
text: in political terms , north yorkshire remains a sea of blue surrounding the tiny red dot of york central .
there are eight parliamentary constituencies in north yorkshire , seven of them have re-elected conservative mps .
rachel maskell remains the areas only labour mp .
what do you think of the election result ?
here 's what some people in york think :

documents.title: 'serious questions ' for conservatives - pudsey mp
text: conservative stuart andrew has held onto his pudsey and horsforth seat , but by a much reduced majority of 331 , with labour gaining in the constituency by 9.2 % .
a recount was held , the returned mp said `` it has been a very tense night '' but called it a `` disappointing night '' for the party as a whole .
in an interview on bbc radio leeds he said that the party now has some `` serious messages from the public to think about . ''
we 've got some serious questions to ask ourselves as a party .
there were certain things about the campaign that were n't effective . ''

documents.title: watch : what went down in hull overnight ?
text: matt bone has a summary of the election results from hull .

documents.title: the moment clegg lost his seat
text: the moment clegg lost his seat

documents.title: former hull mayor ejected from election count
text: former hull mayor ejected from election count

documents.title: this is the general election 2017
text: throughout the general election campaign paul ballington from rotherham , aka the singing plumber has been sharing his take on the campaign with a song every friday .
this week is no different , as he took to the mic with his guitar and his choir for one last ditty .
oh , and in a side note he 's getting married this afternoon !
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: hull east mp congratulates corbyn
text: labour 's karl turner has been re-elected to the hull east seat , with a majority of 10,396 .
he was one of the mps who resigned from the labour cabinet last year , but this morning he was one of those to congratulate jeremy corbyn .
he said `` things are very different since our resignations a little bit over a year ago .
the man has just probably ensured that thersa may has lost the election .
for goodness sake , let me congratulate the leader of the labour party for securing that .
i congratulate jeremy for putting a good manifesto forward , it 's been positive .
it 's about hope over fear . ''

documents.title: sheffield hallam reaction
text: the big general election shock in south yorkshire was nick clegg of the lib dems losing his sheffield hallam seat to jared o'mara of labour .
here 's the moment the returning officer announced this result :
mr o'mara took the seat with a majority of 2,125 votes and promised to stand-up for the people who elected him to the house of commons :
once the result was announced nick clegg took to the stage to thank his constituents and to look ahead to what might be in store politically over the coming days :
author: Adam Pinder-Smith
BBC Local Live, Yorkshire

documents.title: nick clegg on losing his seat
text: nick clegg on losing his seat

documents.title: theresa may 'damaged goods '
text: what next for the conservatives and theresa may ?
so far , the bbc understands that the prime minister has no intention of resigning , but the pressure on her wo n't go away quickly .
speaking to bbc radio leeds , the former conservative mp for bradford north , geoff lawler said theresa may is now `` damaged goods '' .
but he says he thinks there will be an `` arrangement '' with the dup leaving her with a have a fragile majority .
it 's a terrible night for the conservatives .
the lesson is you do n't put party politics above the country . ''

documents.title: listen : 'shell shocked ' : robert goodwill conservative mp for scarborough and whitby
text: theresa may 's decision to call a snap general election has backfired .
the conservatives have lost their majority and britain has a hung parliament .
the prime minister is facing calls to stand down , with boris johnson an early favourite to replace her .
conservative robert goodwill narrowly retained his scarborough and whitby seat , but his majority of 6,000 has been almost halved with labour receiving over 20,000votes .
he says he 's loyal to theresa may , but thinks she 'll be shell shocked and will be `` considering her next move '' :

documents.title: reaction from hull west and hessle 's new mp
text: labour 's emma hardy has been elected to the hull west and hessle seat with a majority of 8,025 .
she replaces alan johnson who stepped down before the election , after 20 years in the job , but she says she 's more than ready to take on the challenge .
emma hardy said `` i 'm absolutely delighted that people have put their trust and their faith in me , and i wo n't let them down ''
`` i think it 's quite simply a message that hope will win over hate . ''

documents.title: the general election : an expert 's view
text: we 've been bringing you reaction through the night to results of the general election with our bbc reporters at counts across yorkshire .
it seems the conservatives will be in the biggest party in the house of commons but without an overall majority , followed by labour .
dr. andy price is head of politics at sheffield hallam university and sums up what 's happened :

documents.title: listen : 'election was cynical move ' - greg mulholland , ousted mp
text: west yorkshire 's general election results show it was labour 's night .
it 's increased its number of seats from 14 to 17 .
the conservatives lost two , meaning they now have five and west yorkshire 's only liberal democrat mp , greg mulholland , was pushed into second place by alex sobel for labour .
mr mulholland says calling an election was a `` cynical '' move that 's backfired and thinks theresa may should resign :

documents.title: listen : 'a very weak prime minister now ' - bassetlaw 's labour mp , john mann
text: theresa may 's decision to call a snap general election to secure a bigger majority in the house of commons has backfired .
the conservatives are forecast to be the largest party , but are short of an overall majority .
after a dramatic night , the labour leader , jeremy corbyn , has called for the prime minister to resign .
in nottinghamshire , labour 's john mann held on to bassetlaw , but with a reduced majority .
he says theresa may made a big mistake in calling the general election :

documents.title: yvette cooper : may ca n't carry on
text: senior labour mp yvette cooper says `` it 's great we 're winning back seats for labour '' and `` i applaud the hard work of jeremy corbyn and all activists . ''
theresa may called this election as `` a referendum on herself and she has lost , i do n't see how she can carry on '' , she adds .

ms cooper , who retained normanton , pontefract and castleford , voted against jeremy corbyn in last year 's leadership election , but now stresses `` he won twice and that 's why the party came together in this campaign to achieve this result '' .

she says there is `` real hope for the country '' :

documents.title: defeated colne valley candidate
text: conservative jason mccartney has tweeted after losing his colne valley seat in huddersfield .
the mp , who at the start of the evening was relatively safe , lost the constituency to labour with a 5.5 % swing .
proud of my team & proud to have been the mp for the colne & holme valleys and lindley for 7 magnificent years # teamjason
jason you have been a magnificent constituent mp and i 'm very disappointed at your result .
please visit us at rotary - you r an hon member !
thanks paul !
sorry to see you go .
seems a lot of foul play played a big part in labour getting into our area .
thanks for the 7 years .
what foul play ?
or is it a typo for foul may ?
sounds like sour grapes to me @ twitterid
just all that about how much labour will save our a and e. when this man has already been working his ass off to save it !
poster scandals !
understood but has n't tory nhs restructuring and underfunding put a+e in peril ?
i hear jason mccartney was a vg mp but a tory sadly .
there a lot of reasons why it is in peril including the last labour government .
end of the day good guy , great mp and a shame all round .
very badly let down by your leader and her approach , no reflection on the years of hard graft you have put in for the area jason .
# keepgoing
thank you for your support over the last 7 years for the victims of contaminated blood - this will not be forgotten
very disappointing to see you lose your seat .
hope you 'll consider standing at the next election .
@ twitterid i 'm gutted , thanks for the last 7 years # teamjason # teamblue
well play @ twitterid
i have n't always agreed with politics of your party , but you 've been a very good constituency mp , shame an unnecessary election did for you !
thanks for all your hard work in our beautiful valleys the last 7 years , you 've been brilliant !
i hope you choose to stand again in future .
pretty shocked you did n't win .
one of the hardest working most visible mps in the area for a long time .
a real shame for your constituency .
colne valley and yourself let down by an incompetent leader .

documents.title: norman lamb 'very sad ' that nick clegg lost seat
text: norman lamb , who 's been re-elected as liberal democrat mp for north norfolk , has paid tribute to nick clegg after he lost the sheffield hallam seat to labour .
mr lamb said it was `` very sad '' , as mr clegg was `` a good friend and a close colleague '' .
`` i think , when the history books are written , people will see that he served this country well , '' mr lamb said .
`` although the coalition was enormously controversial , it gave the country stability at a dangerous time in our history when the economics could have gone very nasty for this country .
`` he provided stability through the coalition and i think he 's served our country well .
it 's sad that he 's gone . ''

documents.title: former leeds north west mp says goodnight
text: liberal democrat greg mulholland , who lost his leeds north west seat to labour , has tweeted this :
night night all , it 's been an honour & a privilege .
thank you for your tireless service to all your constituents and personally to our family .
all the best for whatever you do next .
thank you very much lynsey , from you that means a huge amount .
i did my best to support you & other families & campaign on associated issues
sorry to see you go greg .
best of luck for the future .
take some time off to enjoy some of those proper pubs you helped save !
having lived in lnw for several years , sorry to see you go , you 're one of the good ones .
good luck forthe future .
this
thank you for all you 've done for otley and best wishes for what comes next for you .
gutted for you greg , no one will come close to the amount you 've done for otley , thanks very much and all the best mate
thank you for all your work on the orphan drugs and vimizim .
it made a big difference to the families affected
thanks for all you 've done greg - you 're a bloody hero of the movement
greg you are the best !
greg .
upset .
thousands of publicans shocked and saddened look forward to your next moves
sad to hear this - you provided a great service for your constituents & to the city of leeds .
all the best in whatever you choose to do next
so grateful for all your hard work and so very sorry to see you go .
you 're a great mp greg and have served the community well and i 'm sure you 'll bounce back
see you down the pub for sing-song some time greg
thanks for all your hard work in leeds nw
sorry to see you go greg .
thank you for your help and support on tsc - good luck for the future .
@ twitterid @ twitterid
been our lnw mp since i was 11 and i remember you always working tirelessly for us # bestofluck # greatguy
thanks for your support & all you 've achieved over the years greg @ twitterid has very large boots to fill !

rachelreevesmp
incredibly proud to be re-elected as the member of parliament for leeds west .
thank you - it 's a huge honour .
incredibly proud to be re-elected as the member of parliament for leeds west .
thank you - it 's a huge honour .
congratulations on such a fantastic result .
hope swimming all those lengths kept you sane throughout the process !
thanks tracy and see you back in the pool soon !
and we are lucky to have you back !
thanks !
appreciate that .
many congrats .
hope to catch up soon
thanks margaret .
well done in scotland too ! !
i know !
on our way back .
martin nearly made it too !
and kate !
oh yes ! !
many congrats to you too .
so close !
what a brilliant campaign from you both
perhaps now you might acknowledge the existence of jeremy corbyn and the spirited and decent campaign he ran ?
excellent news and looking forward to continuing to work with you on the # asbestosinschools campaigns
very well done rachel- really looking forward to continuing to work with you on all the great work thats going on in armley
are you now going to get behind jeremy corbyn in every possible way that you can ?
just out of interest on doorsteps what was feeling about may and corbyn ?
do yourself a favour start believing in your leader will you
congratulations , rachel !
very happy to have voted for you .
please help your new supporters by at least respecting we share the vision of jeremy corbyn & support him ?
congratulations rachel on winning your seat again .
well deserved ; thank you for all your help with our situation with # camhs .
you 're an mp who truly cares for her constituents .

documents.title: the gamble that went wrong
text: nick robinson
bbcnickrobinson
the face of a woman who gambled big time & lost ( though she will probably survive as pm at first )
the face of a woman who gambled big time & lost ( though she will probably survive as pm at first )
was very disappointed to see you describe her as `` heavily made up . ''
you convey the same ( valid ) point here without playing to sexist tropes .
totally .
as a bbc employee and license payer/stakeholder , i 'm seriously upset by this .
spoiled an otherwise excellent # bbcelection show .
complaint made .
everyone 's been top notch tonight , thanks @ twitterid for letting the side down # ffs
`` heavily made up , as if she might have been in tears earlier '' oh please ! !
i ca n't stand the tories but this trash , sexist speculation
at least now she has something to talk about with hilary clinton .
how can she possibly ?
this is all of her own making .
she is finished .
`` heavily made up '' `` tears '' come on you 're better than that !
no way you would say such things about a man .
@ twitterid
and i 'm in no way an apologist for her
how can we trust her judgement ?
she 's exposed herself as a floored politician .
but at least we have a proper opposition now .
tories infighting will now be out in the open
@ twitterid called election bcus economy is crashing .
act of desperation .
# bankruptbritain wonder what markets will do ?
let 's make it less personal and much more professional shall we ?
'made up as though she 'd been crying ' that 's not news # speculation
@ twitterid will survive and she will surprise .
never underestimate her .
she maybe robotic , but robots are not made of feathers .
needs to get her 'game face ' on !
remainers did not relish this mandate mess .
a period with a pm in place approx .
3 months .
rather than strengthen her hand by with a bigger majority her misjudgement has only empowered the opposition .
author: Nick Robinson
Presenter, Radio 4 Today

documents.title: harrogate and knaresborough result in detail

both having increased their share of the vote .
turnout was 73.4 % a rise of 3.6 % on 2015 .

text: turnout figures for doncaster north are up on 2015 when ed milliband held the seat for labour on a turnout of 55 %
doncaster council
mydoncaster
# doncaster north # ge2017 stats : turnout : 58.57 % verified : 42,388 electorate : 72,377
# doncaster north # ge2017 stats : turnout : 58.57 % verified : 42,388 electorate : 72,377
this marks a 20 year turnout high .
you 've got to go back to '97 when turnout was 63.3 % in # doncasternorth

documents.title: armed police on duty at doncaster count
text: emma glasbey
emmaglasbey
armed police on duty at doncaster election count @ twitterid # ge2017 # bbcelection
armed police on duty at doncaster election count @ twitterid # ge2017 # bbcelection
i though scenes like these were only in post apocalyptic movies or in despot sates
police on duty , shocking .

documents.title: resist the prawn salad
text: i am playing a little game of how long i can resist my prawn salad to keep things interesting here in huddersfield tonight .
we 're still waiting for the results for the huddersfield , dewsbury , batley and spen and colne valley seats .
author: Nick Ahad
BBC Radio Leeds

documents.title: turnout is up for york seats ?
text: counting is now under way for both the york central and york outer seats .
we 've no official turnout figure yet but i have been told it is higher than in 2015 and is expected to be above 70 % in both seats .
author: Sarah Urwin
Political Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: when will we know who has won ?
text: if you 're trying to decide when to go to bed or to make a quick drink then the bbc 's has this guide to when things will happen overnight .
you can also set up a message alert when your constituency declares its result so you do n't miss it .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live

documents.title: green candidate says turnout is up
text: we 've not had any indication on turnout tonight but the green candidate for sheffield central , natalie bennett tells me it is higher than in 2015 .
she said a lot of students have told her they have voted for the first time .
only time will tell what impact it will have on the result here .
author: Charlotte Rose
BBC Radio Sheffield Political Reporter

documents.title: police presence at count to 'reassure ' public
text: there 's a visible police presence at the harrogate count tonight .
north yorkshire police said they 'd be patrolling to reassure public .
author: Kate Gibson
BBC Radio York

documents.title: count underway in leeds central , as the labour candidate hilary benn arrives
text: count underway in leeds central , as the labour candidate hilary benn arrives

documents.title: liberal democrats say 'no deal '
text: following the exit poll suggesting the conservatives will not win an overall majority the liberal democrats are apparently saying there will be no deal or coalition .
lib dem press office
libdempress
we are getting a lot of calls so just to be clear : no coalition .
no deals .
we are getting a lot of calls so just to be clear : no coalition .
no deals .
why ?
genuinely want to know .
obviously the last coalition was a disaster for ld but do you not want to help serve the country ?
because when the shit hits , it sticks on the minority party .
it 'd be like 2010-15 all over again and look where that got them .
yes i understand that , but i actually think they did a good job in coalition .
their mistake was tuition fees .
they could make difference now
i vote ld , i think they did well too .
but everyone remembers one big cock up , if that happened again it 'd ruin them .
anyway who knows if their seats would even be enough to help labour .
or if it 's even needed .
indeed .
surely they could rectify that by siding with labour who aim to abolish tuition fees ?
as we 've learnt with tuition fees , one thing to offer it and another thing to deliver it
oh come on .
you 'd rather everyone who voted for your party was left with 5 more years of tory austerity ? ? !
@ twitterid will lose my vote and membership over this i 'm sad to say .
yep .
i ca n't trust them if they 're honestly prepared to walk away from a coalition with labour & leave us to a hard brexit under the tories .
walking away from two parties that will inevitably hurt the poor is not a bad thing .
the greater danger is a second election where fatigue leads to a lower turnout and we lose the regains .
we can influence more in coalition .
no coalition .
i despise labour .
i despise the conservatives .
we are here to take over .
and i say that as a person who 's voted lib dem basically her entire adult life .
i could not care less who you vote for .
progressives alliance would be a whole different story for ld !
negotiate - insist on 2nd referendum on the deal .
make that the clincher x
they 've tried a coalition before .
it set them back 15 years
tory coalition ! ! !
totally different story .
lib dem voters are progressives
are they ?
uk needs anew centrist party .
libdem abandoned their centre policy to chase disenchanted labour voters when jc moved to hard left
sorry but what 's the point lib dem running if they wo n't do coalition ?
they ca n't be in power with a majority not in our lifetimes
we would do it but not with corbyn or may , due to their brexit stance .
corbyn wants a soft brexit that leaves us in a ( relatively ) good position .
i 'm not sure he does .
keir starmer says freedom of movement is dead , so therefore so is staying in the single market .

documents.title: postal votes 'hold the key '
text: liberal democrat candidate for the haltemprice and howden seat , david nolan , has just told me that postal votes could hold the key for the overall result .
the seat was held by david davis for the conservatives in 2015 with a majority of over 16,000 .
author: Sarah Sanderson
Political Reporter East Yorkshire and Lincolnshire

documents.title: why a thursday ?
text: just why do we vote on a thursday ?
every election since the 1930s has been held on that day of the week but there is no legal requirement for elections to be held on a thursday .
here 's some thoughts on why it might have ended up an election tradition .

text: sarah
sarah urwin
my view for the night at the count for york central and york outer # bbcelection # ge2017 @ twitterid
my view for the night at the count for york central and york outer # bbcelection # ge2017 @ twitterid
do n't forget the traditional twitter pic of the sun rising over energise in the morning as you wait for the result
do n't remind me !
everyone loves a good sunrise snap ! !
not sunset !
yes , but ideally not after being awake foe 30 houra straight
turns out i missed the sunrise i 'll just have to wait until the next one !
turnout higher or lower ?
i read considerably higher than 2015 , in central and outer .
yep somewhere in the 70s - no official figures yet though !
2015 york outer was 68.8 % york central 63.3 %
thanks sarah .
have a , goid night
what 's the estimated time for the results ?
somewhere between 4 and 6 !
loooooong night .
hope they have coffee on tap !
@ twitterid @ twitterid eyes down forva full house # lookbusy
where 's it at ?
can anyone spectate ?

documents.title: candidate ponders shock result
text: eric broadbent the labour candidate here in scarborough and whitby tells me he is expecting a `` shock result '' tonight .
the conservative 's robert goodwill held the constituency with a majority of over 6,000 in 2015 .
author: Mike Kemp
Reporter, BBC Radio York

documents.title: counting has begun in south yorkshire
text: the count has begun in the sheffield hallam and penistone/stocksbridge seats .
author: Jonny McGuigan

documents.title: calm before the storm
text: it 's definitely the calm before the storm here at the harrogate conference centre .
we expect the verification of votes to be completed by midnight
author: Kate Gibson
BBC Radio York

documents.title: counting has started in leeds
text: richard edwards
reporterich
counting well underway at # leeds # ge2017 @ twitterid
counting well underway at # leeds # ge2017 @ twitterid

documents.title: ballot boxes have begun to arrive at eis sheffield
text: ballot boxes have begun to arrive at eis sheffield

documents.title: exit polls looks at possible hung parliament
text: like every other part of the country our local politicians will be reeling from the exit poll which predicts a hung parliament .
ahead of the 22:00 bst poll most of the talk in yorkshire was about labour hanging on to seats like halifax , dewsbury and scunthorpe .
the exit poll suggests that labour could not only hang retain these seats but instead win seats like morley and outwood and keighley back from the conservatives

documents.title: watch : postal vote on par with 2015 in doncaster
text: postal vote turnout on par with 2015 in doncaster says jo miller , chief exec of doncaster council .

documents.title: vote counters ready for busy night
text: it 's me and david harrison at the guildhall in hull tonight .
all the hull parliamentary seats will be declared here this evening .
the first counters have arrived and are set up .
and the ballot boxes have begun to arrive .
author: Matthew Bone
Video Journalist, BBC Look North

documents.title: postal vote turnout on par with 2015 in doncaster
text: postal vote turnout on par with 2015 in doncaster

documents.title: first ballot boxes arrive
text: matthew bone
mattbonebbc
first ballot boxes arriving in hull .
first ballot boxes arriving in hull .
that 's our ballot box , hope we make a difference .

documents.title: a long night ahead for 'unsung ' heroes
text: spare a thought for the thousands of men and women across yorkshire and lincolnshire who are working to ensure every vote is counted tonight .
from returning officers and stewards to the army of people who 'll count each and every ballot paper .
you could say they 're the unsung heroes of the electoral world .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live

documents.title: exit poll predicts conservatives largest party
text: according to the bbc/itv/sky exit poll , the conservatives are the largest party , but may be short of a majority .

documents.title: all over bar the counting
text: that 's it !
polling stations have closed across yorkshire .
registered voters were able to cast their ballots until 22:00 bst .
counting in most of the uk will take place overnight with the first results nationally expected around midnight .
yorkshire 's first results are expected in the early hours of friday morning .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live

documents.title: welcome to our live coverage of the general election 2017
text: good evening and welcome to yorkshire live 's coverage of election night .
we 'll have reaction from the winners and the losers as the results roll-in and bring you all the drama from the various counting areas across the region .
you can get involved too by sending us your reaction to yorkshire 's new political landscape by clicking here .
author: Tim Dale
BBC Local Live
